definition: A term commonly employed in psychology and philosophy to describe the perception of an organized whole or structure, typically referring to the way elements are perceived as a unified entity rather than individual parts. It is often used to discuss the holistic nature of visual perception and the understanding of complex patterns or forms.

examples.german: Die Gestalt des Gebäudes ist beeindruckend.
examples.english: The shape of the building is impressive.

examples.german: Die Gestalt des Märchens hat sich im Laufe der Zeit verändert.
examples.english: The form of the fairy tale has changed over time.

examples.german: Die Gestalt des Problems wird deutlicher, wenn man es aus verschiedenen Blickwinkeln betrachtet.
examples.english: The nature of the problem becomes clearer when viewed from different perspectives.

examples.german: Die Gestalttherapie ist eine Form der Psychotherapie.
examples.english: Gestalt therapy is a form of psychotherapy.
